location: A park near Middleham Castle In Yorkshire.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Now, my Lord Hastings and Sir William Stanley, Leave off to wonder why I drew you hither, Into this chiefest thicket of the park. Thus stands the case: you know our king, my brother, Is prisoner to the bishop here, at whose hands He hath good usage and great liberty, And, often but attended with weak guard, Comes hunting this way to disport himself. I have advertised him by secret means That if about this hour he make his way Under the colour of his usual game, He shall here find his friends with horse and men To set him free from his captivity.
Enter KING EDWARD IV and a Huntsman with him

lines.speaker: huntsman
lines.text: This way, my lord for this way lies the game.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Nay, this way, man: see where the huntsmen stand. Now, brother of Gloucester, Lord Hastings, and the rest, Stand you thus close, to steal the bishops deer

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Brother, the time and case requireth haste: Your horse stands ready at the parkcorner.

lines.speaker: hastings
lines.text: To Lynn, my lord, And ship from thence to Flanders.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Well guessd, believe me for that was my meaning.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Stanley, I will requite thy forwardness.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: But wherefore stay we tis no time to talk.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Huntsman, what sayst thou wilt thou go along

lines.speaker: huntsman
lines.text: Better do so than tarry and be hangd.

lines.speaker: gloucester
lines.text: Come then, away lets ha no more ado.

lines.speaker: king edward the fourth
lines.text: Bishop, farewell: shield thee from Warwicks frown And pray that I may repossess the crown.
